message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM

The paper deals with the problem of estimating the spectrum from a single RGB image using deep learning solutions. This involves computer vision (CV) techniques such as image processing and machine learning (ML) techniques such as deep learning. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes efficient deep learning solutions, which involves optimization and training of neural networks, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper also expands the concept of spectral reconstruction to work for RGB images taken in the wild, which involves generalization and adaptation of models, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a likely sub-category. The paper also discusses limitations of generic and sensitivity specialized models, which involves analysis and evaluation of models, making cs.GR (Graphics) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper achieves state-of-the-art competitive results on standard benchmarks, which involves performance evaluation and comparison, making cs.MM (Multimedia) a possible sub-category.
